column4: Hey, I'm trying to enable my Wifi card can someone help me figure this out? I'm reading this: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=2596312 and I've done the three steps, the last one doesn't follow through though.... it gives me this: sudo apt-get remove ndiswrapper-utils
E: Could not get lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock - open (11 Resource temporarily unavailable)
E: Unable to lock the administration directory (/var/lib/dpkg/), is another process using it?

2007-05-06T13:57:00.000Z	|ericsson|	Bradf0rd	to top and kill dpkg
2007-05-06T13:59:00.000Z	Bradf0rd	|ericsson|	to top?
2007-05-06T13:59:00.000Z	|ericsson|	Bradf0rd	type top in the terminal, then located the PID for the process dpkg which most likely is running, press Q to quit and then type: kill (number of the PID)
2007-05-06T14:01:00.000Z	Bradf0rd	|ericsson|	nope. it's not running
2007-05-06T14:02:00.000Z	|ericsson|	Bradf0rd	have you got something called whiptai running there?
2007-05-06T14:02:00.000Z	|ericsson|	Bradf0rd	whiptai+l ;)
2007-05-06T14:02:00.000Z	Bradf0rd	|ericsson|	nope...
2007-05-06T14:03:00.000Z	Bradf0rd	|ericsson|	does that list show absolutely everything that's running?
2007-05-06T14:05:00.000Z	|ericsson|	Bradf0rd	have you tried running lshw, ifconfig or lspci to see if it detects the card?
2007-05-06T14:06:00.000Z	Bradf0rd	|ericsson|	Well, the CARD is detected in  in lspci
2007-05-06T14:07:00.000Z	|ericsson|	Bradf0rd	do you see anything if you do sudo ifconfig then?
2007-05-06T14:07:00.000Z	Bradf0rd	|ericsson|	I'll check
2007-05-06T14:09:00.000Z	Bradf0rd	|ericsson|	if doesn't show up in sudo ifconfig
2007-05-06T14:11:00.000Z	|ericsson|	Bradf0rd	can you do sudo iwconfig?
2007-05-06T14:12:00.000Z	Bradf0rd	|ericsson|	lo        no wireless extensions.
2007-05-06T14:13:00.000Z	|ericsson|	Bradf0rd	try to type: tail -f /var/log/messages and see if you come up with any reasons as to why
2007-05-06T14:14:00.000Z	Bradf0rd	|ericsson|	k
2007-05-06T14:16:00.000Z	Bradf0rd	|ericsson|	PM
2007-05-06T14:17:00.000Z	|ericsson|	Bradf0rd	I didn't get any pm, try to join #quietplace instead :)
